europeana:record.dc:title: Nematois australis Heydenreich, 1851 (currently Adela australis; Insecta; Lepiodoptera): proposed presedence over Tinea aldrovandella Villers 1789
Various articles
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kozlov M.V.
Nieukerken, van E.J.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Insecta
Nomenclature
taxonomy
Adelidae
Adela australis
Tinea aldrovandella
europeana:record.dc:description: The purpose of this application, under articles 23.9.3 and 81.2.3 of the Code, is to conserve the widely used specific name Adela australis (Heydenreich, 1851) for a common south European fairy moth (family Adelidae) by giving it precedence over the questionable senior synonym Tinea aldrovandella Villers 1789. T. aldrovandella was not used after publication until 1980 when it was mentioned as a possible synonym of A. australis. Since 1980, some, but not all authors have accepted this synonymy.
